result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold Edward Estep Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon - Knife], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 11 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $543 costs, consecutive to sentence.

Consecutive to any sentence now serving.  With Huber and diversion.  Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 8-26-2016; to Report by 10-21-2016.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Harold Edward Estep in court with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim present.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 49 days Rock Co Jail, consecutive to any sentence now serving; with Huber and diversion; 11 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $543 costs, consecutive to sentence; no sentence credit; bond to be refunded.
